data.title: Homeland Integrated Security Systems Completes Development of Cyber Tracker V.1
data.meta_description: ASHEVILLE, N.C., Aug. 30, 2005 (PRIMEZONE) -- Homeland Integrated Security Systems, Inc. (Pink Sheets:HISC), in conjunction with Arcom, is pleased to...
data.text:
ASHEVILLE, N.C., Aug. 30, 2005 (PRIMEZONE) -- Homeland Integrated Security Systems, Inc. (Pink Sheets:HISC), in conjunction with Arcom, is pleased to announce that they have successfully completed the development of the Cyber Tracker V.1 and are ready to begin manufacturing. The Cyber Tracker is on schedule to be delivered for fourth quarter of this year.

Homeland Integrated Security System's patent-pending Cyber Tracker is a portable detection device designed to provide real-time GPS tracking of vehicles, people or other mobile or movable objects. Its convenient rugged design (5" x 5" x 1") makes it applicable in a variety of situations where it is necessary to know an exact location of a person or object. It features "Push to Talk" ability and an extended battery life. The Cyber Tracker's unique design and features make the product ideal for consumer retail, School Systems, Ports, Fleet Management, the Military, and Public Safety.

"Now that we're ready to manufacture the Cyber Tracker, our focus will be building a sales infrastructure that can target the various verticals for which the Cyber Tracker applies," stated Frank Moody, CEO, Homeland Integrated Security Systems Inc.

According to Ian Riley, CTO of Homeland Integrated Security Systems, "It is an industry-changing device that will take GPS to new levels. With the completion of Cyber Tracker V.1, new markets and verticals will be opened."

Homeland Integrated Security Systems has already selected Barry Bennett, former President Bush Advisor, to lead the Governmental Sales division; while, Adam Clough, former Nextel Executive, will be responsible for consumer retail sales.

Homeland Integrated Security Systems recently announced that it received a blanket purchase order from Pro.Sec, a Middle Eastern security company, for 5000 Cyber Trackers. The order translates to $2.5 million for the hardware, which does not include subsequent fees for the software and service. Homeland Integrated Security Systems will begin shipments to Pro.Sec in the fourth quarter of 2005.

About Arcom

Arcom is a U.K.-based design and manufacturing company with design, sales and technical support in Kansas City, USA and Cambridge, England. Arcom is a wholly owned subsidiary of Spectris (LSE:SXS), the precision instrumentation and controls company. Embedded board manufacturing is located in England, Shenzhen (China) and Taipei (Taiwan) while complete system assembly takes place in Cambridge, Kansas City and Shenzhen. Established in 1982, Arcom uses design and production procedures accredited to ISO9001:2000 Arcom is actively involved in a number of partner programs, which provide Arcom and its customers with the highest level of technical support:

Arcom is an Advanced Level Business Partner with IBM;

Arcom is a General member of the Intel Communication Alliance and has worked closely with Intel's Telematics team to produce XScale based solutions; and

Arcom is a Gold-level partner (IHV) in the Microsoft Windows Embedded Partner program (WEP).

About Homeland Integrated Security Systems:

Homeland Integrated Security Systems owns proprietary technology and has the rights to use patents to some of the most innovative and sophisticated security products. One of the key target markets is the 361 commercial seaports in the U.S. which are vulnerable to criminal penetration. For more information go to www.hissusa.com.

For more information please visit our website www.hissusa.com or contact Matt Maguire 1-866 THE APPL(E)

Statements regarding financial matters in this press release other than historical facts are "forward-looking statements" within the meaning of section 27A of the Securities Act of 1933, Section 21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, and as that term is defined in the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. The company intends that such statements about the Company's future expectations, including future revenues and earnings, technology efficacy and all other forward-looking statements be subject to the safe harbors created thereby. Homeland Integrated Security Systems, Inc. is a development stage company who continues to be dependent upon outside capital to sustain its existence. Since these statements (future operational results and sales) involve risks and uncertainties and are subject to change at any time, the Company's actual results may differ materially from expected results.
